We went here for brunch. The ambience was nice, and the service was good. We were seated immediately, and we were surrounded by so many delicious looking dishes. My two friends ordered their ´recovery brunches´. They were both very satisfied, and the portions were huge. I ordered the Morning Glory because I wanted something sweet (french toast topped with greek yogurt and mixed berries). I was excited when I first got it, because it looked like it´d be a perfect balance of sweet. The greek  yogurt and berries would add some tart to the french toast´s sweetness. However, I know french toast isn´t always sweet, but if you´re like me (who loves french toast with various sugary syrups), don´t get the Morning Glory. It tasted like soft toast with tart greek yogurt.However, I know that the other dishes were pretty good, so thus my 4 star review.
